instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light but not turn on
threads.message:
Hi,
Unit has minor water damaged, green light but not turn on
smc bypass it turn on and 
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>=0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>=0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>=0v

PP3V42=3.4v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> at 3v on pins 1/2= 3.2v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>=4.9v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>=3.42
Any help please.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light but not turn on
threads.message:
Do you get S3 voltages in SMC bypass mode?
But missing all S0 ones?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light but not turn on
threads.message:
S3 V in SMC bypass mode: PP1V5R1V35_S3=1.5v,
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>=3.29v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>=5v.
S0 Mode:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>=5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>=3.2v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light but not turn on
threads.message:
Some voltages don't have S3/0 in the name, but you should know which sleep state are related to.
VCORE???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light but not turn on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light but not turn on
threads.message:
So your board turns on, but not working; is a difference.
Board tries to turn on in normal mode at least?
Check for pulse at big coils.

Do you note any variation on VCORE in the first 10-15s?
<SIGNAL>PCIE_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?

Did you try known good BIOS?

Post exact ohm resistance to ground at L6995; should be higher than 30K.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light but not turn on
threads.message:
All big coils= .99 to 12V.
 variation on VCORE in the first 10-15s, 1.1V to drop  0.99V
<SIGNAL>PCIE_RESET_L</SIGNAL>=3.2V stable.
not tried good bios.
exact ohm resistance to ground at L6995= 2M

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light but not turn on
threads.message:
"Board tries to turn on in normal mode at least?"
???

Do you get USB activity, when board turns on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light but not turn on
threads.message:
Know good bios no luck.
how do i know that it tries to turn on in normal mode? It turn on  only bypass SMC. Yes, USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light but not turn on
threads.message:
"how do i know that it tries to turn on in normal mode?"
Any pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SX_L</SIGNAL> signals, when trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?

BTW, this board doesn't turn on by itself, like iCore boards; need to press power button.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light but not turn on
threads.message: BTW, this board doesn't turn on by itself, like iCore boards;  , You are absolutely right, KB issue, Solve by changed KB. Thanks.
